active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate why bulk phishing campaigns remain effective despite widespread cybersecurity awareness (e.g., 74% of breaches due to human error), and propose two novel defenses tailored to organizational contexts.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Penetration Testing and Ethical Hacking. Topic: Bulk Phishing Campaigns (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Penetration Testing And Ethical Hacking > Social Engineering Testing > 007_Digital Attack Vectors and Techniques > Email-Based Attacks > Bulk Phishing Campaigns). Incorporate this research context: Bulk phishing = large-scale, non-targeted phishing to thousands/millions (vs. spear: individual-targeted; whaling: executives). Prevalent in 80% of cyberattacks; 74% breaches from human error. Components: generic lures, mass distribution (bots/lists), evasion (spoofing). Ethical pentest: use Gophish/kits with consent. Standards: CISA Phishing Guidance, NIST, SPF/DKIM/DMARC. Sources: cisa.gov/phishing-guidance, pentasecurity.com/phishing-landscape, eset.com/phishing-scams. Use these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [insert full list above] - Scaffolding: [insert 4 layers above] - Active Learning: [insert activities above] - Bloom's progression: Ensure coverage. Generate flashcards per schema: [insert full flashcard_schema above] Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'scaffolding_layer': '...', 'active_learning_link': '...'}}, ...]. Ensure completeness, accuracy, and voter priorities (clear definitions, stats, concept map integration).
